顺便转一个IGN的新闻：

Minecraft seems to be leading the charge for a new wave of do-it-yourself game development going on. Earlier this week we reported on XBL Minecraft clone Fortresscraft, and then Terraria came to our attention.

We reached out to Andrew Spinks, the game's creator and programmer, to ask whether Minecraft was an inspiration at all. "Notch succeeded in making a very unique game that has been enjoyed by millions of people," said Spinks. "I hope to be able to do the same someday."

Spinks has done all of the game's coding himself, though he said he's also had assistance from a team of around 20 testers for some of the design decisions and a few of the graphics. He's been working on the game since January, and although there isn't an official release date yet, he told us, "We have been approached by a large distribution network, which might speed up the game's release."

MC的2D横向动作加强版...嗯...或许不该叫山寨...毕竟它主要偏重在动作打怪, 虽说参考了不少MC的东西, 但也没照样全搬, 至少呈现的方式完全不同, 该算是创意启发吧. 

MC不也是受到矮人要塞, 地城守护者之类游戏的启发才诞生的吗? 重点是看该游戏是否能从其他游戏的影子下走出自己的道路.
